messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Advertising (was TV etc)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh, but if your brain had unfogged, you would have been able to say the same thing in way fewer words! Joyce, an official member of the Pam H. Fan Club!
messages.messageBody:
on 2/6/03 2:24 PM, Pam Hartley at pamhartley@... wrote:

> First, as an official member of the Joyce Fan Club, I just have to say:
> GREAT post! I was going to answer and my brain was too foggy and I was
> hoping someone else would come along and answer and, like summoning a genie,
> voila! -- Joyce. ;)

Oh, but if your brain had unfogged, you would have been able to say the same
thing in way fewer words!

Joyce, an official member of the Pam H. Fan Club! :-)

messages.subject: Re: Advertising (was TV etc)
messages.msgSnippet: ... First, as an official member of the Joyce Fan Club, I just have to say: GREAT post! I was going to answer and my brain was too foggy and I was hoping
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3002
>Date: Thu, Feb 6, 2003, 9:22 AM
>

> Again, reality doesn't match what we fear will happen. Advertising isn't
> that hard to understand. It's a pretty simple concept. I've always trusted
> that my daughter is intelligent enough to get the concept.


First, as an official member of the Joyce Fan Club, I just have to say:
GREAT post! I was going to answer and my brain was too foggy and I was
hoping someone else would come along and answer and, like summoning a genie,
voila! -- Joyce. ;)

Re: advertising -- it was pretty easy for my daughters to grasp the concept
of people trying to sell them things and learning that things did not always
work in the way advertised. A valuable bit of knowledge, I think, for
anybody in our society.

Pam
